snippet: Yang Maodong, better known by his pen name, Guo Feixiong, is the second well-known member of China’s “rights defense” movement to be arrested in recent weeks.
abstract: Police in southern China have detained Yang Maodong, outspoken advocate of democratic rights, on charges of disrupting public order; Yang's friends and family say his detention is another step in a government effort to stifle dissidents who have challenged the Communist Party over censorship and officials' wealth.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Yang Maodong, better known by his pen name, Guo Feixiong, is the second well-known member of China’s “rights defense” movement to be arrested in recent weeks.

headline.main: Prominent Advocate Held in Southern China
headline.print_headline: Prominent Advocate Held in Southern China

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
